item.title: Tidy text analysis of the leaked Trump phone calls
item.author: map[username:daniel.berecz host:gmail.com] (Dániel Berecz)
item.description: Last week I read the leaked phone calls between Donald Trump, and the leaders of Mexico, and Australia, and I was again shocked a bit, by the president’s command of the English language. Coincidently, I wanted to read, and try out the things in the Tidy Textmining in R book, so here we are. if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") pacman::p_load(rprojroot, tidyverse, ggplot2, dplyr, rvest, stringi, tidytext, knitr) ## package 'haven' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked ## package 'tidyverse' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked ## ## The downloaded binary packages are in ## C:\Users\daniel.

item.title: Recreating Washing Post's solar eclipse plot in R
item.author: map[host:gmail.com username:daniel.berecz] (Dániel Berecz)
item.description: I will continue copycatting visualization in this post. This I seen the following visualization from a couple of difference sources: Oh, this is cool. https://t.co/eCSKI6ag3P pic.twitter.com/BoBlMjZGV7 — Teddy Amenabar (@TeddyAmen) July 10, 2017 I thought this would also be a good vis to recreate. I had a couple of different ideas on how to recreate it, but little did I know how difficult it would be. Disclaimer: I created this purely with geometrically, it doesn’t represent the true path of of an eclipse.

item.title: Visualizing the flights data from the satRday Visualizaiton Challenge
item.author: map[username:daniel.berecz host:gmail.com] (Dániel Berecz)
item.description: The first satRday was held in Budapest the last year. There was a Visualization Challenge and I decided to participate on it. Unfortunatelly, because of technical difficulties, I couldn’t send my work in before the deadline, but I often come back to this data set, for testing out new things like this blog. Setup I started to get into R around the satRday, and I learned a lot since then, so I decided I update the a code a bit.
